intro: Thesium costatum var. costatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thesium, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in well-drained environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slightly waxy texture. The flowers, which are usually pink or white, bloom in late spring or early summer.
